docs.lead_paragraph: By some estimates, almost one in five babies are given formula made from soy instead of cow's milk during their first year, though little has been firmly established about what effect this may have on their future health. The question has been whether the high levels of phytoestrogens found in soy, similar to the female hormone estrogen, may affect the reproductive system later in life.

headline.main: Reared on Soy and Doing Quite Well

docs.abstract: Study by Dr Brian L Strom and colleagues at University of Pennsylvania finds babies whose formulas are made from soy instead of cow's milk are not adversely effected over long term by high levels of phytoestrogens found in soy; drawing (M)
